intro: Bowlesia oppositifolia, commonly known as the white-flowered bowlesia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its opposite, simple, and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are small, white, and clustered in inflorescences, often appearing in spring. It is typically found in shaded, humid environments within forest understories.
